title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 426.10 - Maximum number of foster children remaining in care for more than 24 months
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 426.10 - Maximum number of foster children remaining in care for more than 24 months

State Regulations

The title IV-E State Plan must set forth specific goals
as required by the provisions of title IV- E of the Federal Social Security Act
for the Federal fiscal years commending on or after October 1, 1983
establishing the maximum number of children who, at any one time during such
year, will remain in foster care after having been in foster care for more than
24 months. For the Federal fiscal year commencing on October 1, 2005 and
thereafter, the goal is 55 percent of all children in foster care with respect
to whom assistance under the State title IV-E Plan for foster care and adoption
assistance is provided during such years. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18

426.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
